english_translation: Narrated by Ka'ab ibn Ujrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ passed by me during the time of Hudaybiyyah, while I was lighting a fire and the lice were falling down. He said: "Do the insects on your head bother you?" I said: "Yes." He said: "Shave (your head) and feed six poor people, or fast three days."

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Ubaid
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Ubaid ibn Hisab al-Azdi

narrators.name: Hammad ibn Zaid
narrators.full_name: Hammad ibn Zaid ibn Dinar al-Azdi

narrators.name: Mujahid
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Malik Mujahid ibn Jabr al-Makki

narrators.name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Layla

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Mujahid is a known mudallis (using 'an term), but he is generally reliable and his tadlis does not significantly impact acceptance
Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla uses 'an (indirect term), which introduces slight ambiguity, combined with his known weaknesses in precision

potential_issues.issue: Mujahid narrates with 'an term - he is known as a mudallis
potential_issues.impact: While Mujahid is generally reliable, his use of 'an introduces ambiguity. However, given his reliability status and agreement of multiple chains on the same narrators, this issue does not significantly impact authenticity

potential_issues.issue: Abd al-Rahman ibn Abi Layla has weak precision
potential_issues.impact: He is classified as Saduq (truthful but weak in transmission). His weakness in preservation combined with indirect transmission term affects reliability

Topics: Incident of Ka'ab ibn Ujrah during Hudaybiyyah
Expiation for shaving head during Ihram

english_translation: Narrated by Ka'ab ibn Ujrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came out to us and said: "Who is here? Do you hear? Verily, after me there will be rulers who work by other than the obedience of Allah. Whoever participates in their works and helps them upon their oppression, is not from me and I am not from him. Whoever does not participate in their works and does not help them upon their oppression, is from me and I am from him."

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

potential_issues.issue: Presence of Hilal (father of Abu Musa), who is classified as Majhul (unknown)
potential_issues.impact: An unknown narrator weakens the chain significantly. This affects the overall reliability of this transmission path

Topics: Distancing from those who serve oppression
Incident of teaching about future rulers

english_translation: Narrated by Ka'ab ibn Ujrah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ came out to us while we were sitting on cushions and said: "Verily, after me there will be rulers. Whoever enters upon them and helps them upon their oppression and lies, is not from me and I am not from him, and will not meet me at the Pool."

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Ibrahim ibn Uthman ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah, Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Ibrahim

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

potential_issues.issue: Multiple indirect transmission terms (عَنْ) in the chain
potential_issues.impact: The chain relies on implicit transmission which introduces ambiguity. However, all narrators are generally reliable, so this does not significantly impact authenticity

Topics: Prohibition of entering unto unjust rulers

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Humaid al-Sa'idi: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ sent a man to Yemen. He came with much wealth. When the Prophet ﷺ sent someone to collect it, the man kept saying: "This is for me and this is for you." They asked: "Where did you get this?" He said: "It was given to me as a gift." When this was reported to the Prophet ﷺ, he said: "Why does he not sit with his family in his house and see if gifts come to him? By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, whatever one of you takes from the booties of war unlawfully will come on the Day of Judgment carrying it on his neck."

narrators.name: al-Hasan ibn Ali al-Wasiti
narrators.full_name: al-Hasan ibn Ali ibn Musaffir al-Wasiti

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Dhakwan
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Dhakwan al-Umawi Abu al-Zinad

narrators.name: Urwah ibn al-Zubayr
narrators.full_name: Urwah ibn al-Zubayr ibn al-Awwam al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Abu Humaid al-Sa'idi
narrators.full_name: Shurahbil ibn al-Hasanah al-Kindi Abu Humaid al-Sa'idi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

Topics: Incident of the governor who misappropriated gifts
Warning against unlawfully taking from booty

english_translation: Narrated by Hudhayfah ibn Usaid: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "There is no prayer for one who does not purify himself, and there is no charity from what is unlawfully gained."

narrators.name: Abu Salamah
narrators.full_name: Abd al-Rahman ibn Abd al-Aziz Abu Salamah

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

Topics: Prohibition of charity from forbidden earnings

english_translation: Narrated by Abaza ibn Qais: I came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: "I have great wealth and a small family. Should I divide my wealth and distribute it?" He said: "No." He said: "Then in what way should I spend it?" He said: "Upon your family and those under your care."

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Ibrahim ibn Uthman ibn Abi Shaybah

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

english_translation: Narrated by Ahmad ibn Abbas: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "The best of you are those who are best to their families, and I am the best among you to my family."

narrators.name: Yaqub ibn Humaid
narrators.full_name: Yaqub ibn Humaid ibn Kasib al-Asadi

narrators.name: Ishaq ibn Ibrahim
narrators.full_name: Ishaq ibn Ibrahim ibn Said ibn Nahsh

narrators.name: Al-Zuhri
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Muslim ibn Shihab al-Zuhri

narrators.name: Ahmad ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Ahmad ibn Muhammad ibn Abbas al-Taghlabi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib

chainIssues: Ibn Shihab al-Zuhri is known as a mudallis but is generally reliable

potential_issues.issue: Al-Zuhri (Ibn Shihab) uses 'an term and is known to practice tadlis
potential_issues.impact: Al-Zuhri is a mudallis according to some scholars, but he is widely recognized as reliable by the majority of scholars. His tadlis does not significantly impact the authenticity of the hadith

Topics: Example of the Prophet ﷺ in family treatment
Virtue of kindness to spouses and relatives

english_translation: Narrated by Abd al-Rahman ibn Bahmah: The Prophet ﷺ forbade sitting by the bedside of a sick person unless there is hope for recovery.
Narrated by Nafi' ibn Jubayr ibn Mutim: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Verily, Allah has forbidden arrogance and lying."
Narrated by Rabiah ibn Yazid: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "The best among you are those who have the best manners and character."
Narrated by Abdullah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "The most beloved actions to Allah are the most consistent, even if they are few."
Narrated by Ali: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "Do not curse those who help in the collection of wealth."
Narrated by Jabir: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ prohibited selling by the unlawfully gained goods.
Narrated by Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "A believer is a mirror to another believer."
Narrated by Mu'adh: The Prophet ﷺ took my hand and said: "O Mu'adh, Do you know what is the right of Allah upon His servants and what is their right upon Him?"
Narrated by Anas: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ encouraged us to love one another.
Narrated by Sa'd: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: "The best of you after me will be those who learn knowledge and teach it."
Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ was the most generous of people.
